alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 2:29PM CDT until May 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Canadian and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen earlier this morning and afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, southern Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Yukon, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Nichols Hills, Forest Park, Woodlawn Park, Lake Aluma, The Fairgrounds, Wiley Post Airport and The Capitol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
